private_information: There is exactly one truck in each city and trucks operate only inside their city.
Truck actions: load(package, truck, location), unload(package, truck, location), drive(truck, from_location, to_location).
Trucks can drive between any two locations inside the same city.
A package can be loaded into a truck only if the package and truck are at the same location.
Once loaded into a truck, the package is in the truck and not at a location.
When unloaded from a truck the package becomes at the truck's location.
truck_manager.goal: Provide a precise, self-contained specification of truck-level entities, predicates, and action constraints suitable for integration into a global transport model.

private_information: Each city has exactly one airport location and each airplane operates between airports in different cities.
Airplane actions: load(package, airplane, airport), unload(package, airplane, airport), fly(airplane, from_airport, to_airport).
A package can be loaded into an airplane only if the package and the airplane are at the same airport.
Once loaded into an airplane, the package is in the airplane and not at an airport.
When unloaded from an airplane the package becomes at the airplane's airport location.
air_manager.goal: Provide a precise, self-contained specification of airplane-level entities, predicates, and action constraints suitable for integration into a global transport model.

private_information: Audit temporal and causal consistency across agent models and detect bookkeeping shortcuts such as implicit capacities, tokens, or post-hoc penalties.
Ensure that load/unload semantics are consistent between truck and airplane models and that location-city membership constraints are explicit.
Flag ambiguities such as different names for the same physical object and require canonicalization.
auditor.goal: Produce an audit report that lists required corrections, canonical names, causal ordering constraints, and any temporal invariants needed before final PDDL generation.

private_information: The orchestrator integrates sub-models and audit corrections to produce a final PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeted to the FastDownwards solver.
The orchestrator must keep actions originating from different agents distinct by namespacing or action prefixes to preserve agent responsibilities.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the supplied truck model, air model, and auditor report to generate a single, coherent PDDL domain and problem compatible with FastDownwards that achieves the global goal.

public_information: We plan logistics to transport packages within cities via trucks and between cities via airplanes.
Locations within a city are fully connected for trucks and each city has exactly one truck.
Each city has exactly one location that serves as an airport and airplanes fly between airports.
Actions available: load into truck, load into airplane, unload from truck, unload from airplane, drive truck between locations in same city, fly airplane between airports in different cities.

Action restrictions: loading requires package and vehicle co-located, loading moves package into vehicle and removes it from a location, unloading moves package to the vehicle location and removes it from vehicle, trucks can only drive inside their city, airplanes can only fly between airports and must be at the origin airport to fly.
Initial facts: location_0_0 is an airport.
Initial facts: location_1_0 is an airport.
Initial facts: airplane_0 is at location_1_0.
Initial facts: package_0 is at location_0_1.
Initial facts: package_1 is at location_1_0.
Initial facts: package_2 is at location_0_1.
Initial facts: package_3 is at location_0_0.
Initial facts: truck_0 is at location_0_0.
Initial facts: truck_1 is at location_1_2.
Location membership facts: location_0_0 is in city city_0.
Location membership facts: location_0_1 is in city city_0.
Location membership facts: location_0_2 is in city city_0.
Location membership facts: location_1_0 is in city city_1.
Location membership facts: location_1_1 is in city city_1.
Location membership facts: location_1_2 is in city city_1.
Global goal: package_0 at location_1_2, package_1 at location_0_1, package_2 at location_1_2, package_3 at location_0_2.

model.system_prompt: You are the truck domain specialist. Produce a clear machine-readable specification of types, predicates, and action schemas relevant to trucks, loading into trucks, unloading from trucks, and driving operations within a city. Do not emit final PDDL domain or problem. Instead provide structured fragments: a list of types, a list of predicates with informal semantics, and action schemas with preconditions and effects expressed in a consistent placeholder syntax.
model.prompt: Your identity is truck_manager. Use the public information {environment->public_information} and your private information {agents->truck_manager->private_information} to produce a truck_model that enumerates types, predicates, and action schemas for truck operations. Make explicit the requirements that trucks and locations belong to cities and that drive actions require same-city membership. Provide examples of instantiations for the objects present in the public information.

model.system_prompt: You are the air domain specialist. Produce a clear machine-readable specification of types, predicates, and action schemas relevant to airplanes, loading into airplanes, unloading from airplanes, and flying between airports. Do not emit final PDDL domain or problem. Instead provide structured fragments: a list of types, a list of predicates with informal semantics, and action schemas with preconditions and effects expressed in a consistent placeholder syntax.
model.prompt: Your identity is air_manager. Use the public information {environment->public_information} and your private information {agents->air_manager->private_information} to produce an air_model that enumerates types, predicates, and action schemas for airplane operations. Make explicit airport constraints and the requirement that fly actions originate and end at airport locations. Provide examples of instantiations for the objects present in the public information.

audit.system_prompt: You are the auditor responsible for temporal and causal consistency. Analyze the provided models and produce a report listing inconsistencies, ambiguous names, implicit bookkeeping shortcuts, missing preconditions or effects, and required canonicalizations. The audit must not produce PDDL but must produce a deterministic list of corrections and invariants the orchestrator must apply.
audit.prompt: Your identity is auditor. You will receive the truck_model and air_model. Using your private information {agents->auditor->private_information} and the public information {environment->public_information}, produce an audit_report that enumerates corrections, canonical name mappings, causal ordering constraints, capacity assumptions to remove or make explicit, and any temporal invariants required for a sound combined model.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator that produces the final PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeted to the FastDownwards solver. Integrate the truck_model, air_model, and audit_report, apply canonicalizations and corrections, and emit a single PDDL domain and a single PDDL problem. Keep actions that originate from different agents distinct by namespacing or a clear prefix. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure the resulting PDDL is compatible with FastDownwards.
pddl.prompt: Your identity is orchestrator. Integrate the inputs {truck_model}, {air_model}, and {audit_report} and the public information {environment->public_information} to produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that achieves the global goal. Make sure actions remain distinct by originating agent. Ensure all predicates, types, objects, initial facts, and goals are explicit and consistent with the auditor corrections. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem>.
